The first thing this cat does every morning is say hi to her lizard brother 💚 (🐱🦎: @cat_n_lizard)

Repost from @americanforests
•
Did you know that if holly (Ilex aquifolium) finds its leaves are being nibbled by deer, it switches genes on to make them spiky when they regrow? So on taller holly trees, the upper leaves (which are out of reach) have smooth edges, while the lower leaves are prickly.

🧐 How you may ask?

All of the leaves on a tree are genetic twins and share exactly the same DNA sequence. By looking in the DNA for traces of a chemical process called methylation, which modifies DNA but doesn't alter the organism's genetic sequence, the team could determine whether leaf variation was a response to environmental or genetic changes. They found that the more a tree had been nibbled on the more methylation was seen. Pretty cool, right??

#holly #science #holiday #christmas #plant #nature #curiousconservationist #outdoors

As the year comes to an end, just wanted to give a shout out for everyone that supported the launch of this passion podcast. We are already 10 episodes in and a lineup waiting for Spring! 

We will be changing to a countdown format (currently just a single topic) at the beginning of the year and I am already loving the flow!! If you have any topics, please feel free to share below :)

🚨 Trigger Warning: Lots of harmless garter snakes

This popped up in my memory! What an amazing trip with @davkaufman and @prairie_exotics. Dav made a great video covering the trip, definitely go watch it on YouTube. 

This was definitely a #fesr2fascination trip. I had been around snakes, but never this many at once. Seeing the ground shift below your feet created a moment of panic, but that was soon washed over with excitement and curiosity. This place was incredible and life changing! So grateful for these two for letting me join.

This is the best part 🎵 

Can anyone name a species in this lineup? 

We had tornado warnings in the morning/afternoon Thursday, but the evening brought some warm, wet weather! Don’t let the rain prevent you from going out in nature, it brings out some of the coolest critters! Getting a head start in #amphibianawarenessweek ! 

🐸 Vernal, or ephemeral, pools are seasonal ‘ponds’ that make ideal spawning habitats for amphibians (salamander eggs can be seen in video). Makes sense, pools that dry up won’t have fish that like to snack on amphibian babies.  These small pools can be puddles in ditches, low spots in forests, an old bucket, etc. When exploring, don’t forget to check those life-serving puddles 😉 

Always grateful to @ogscubasteve for letting me tag along to check some of his favorite roads and ditches. 

#salamander #amphibian #nighthike #millipede #herping #toad #wildlife #creepycrawly #fear2fascination

#Wildturtleweek is next week and I couldn’t be more excited! I was lucky enough to work with a number of partners to put together a really great initiative to protect our wild turtles! (I can show/tell all the good stuff next week).

One thing we can all do is help our wild turtle friends cross roads. Road mortalities are only one of many challenges that wild turtles face. Remember when you used to find box turtles everywhere? Not so much anymore. Predation. Habitat loss. Collecting. Invasive species. Releasing pets.

We will chat more next week for #wildturtleweek, but one thing we can all do is help turtles cross the road safely (only when it’s safe for use to do so).

Things to remember 🧐:

🐢 Make sure it’s safe to get out of your car. Your safety is number one. 

🐢 Is the turtle injured? If so, call a local rehabber. 

🐢 ALWAYS take the turtle in the direction it’s heading. Don’t take it back to the pond it came from or one you know of nearby. Help it in the the direction it’s heading unless you know of immediate danger. Turtles my be ‘slow’, but they are stubborn.

🐢 Don’t transport by its tail. The claws can be sharp and some have a nice bite. If you don’t feel like bare-handing, keep a box in your car (JIC)

🐢 Please don’t take it home and keep it as a pet, even temporarily. This can cause a lot of stress on the animal, especially nesting females. No human would want to be abducted while cruising around, even if it was only for a few hours and they tried feeding your strawberries 😆 Wildlife don’t appreciate it either. 

Tell me your wild turtle stores below! I love hearing them. 

#curiousconservationist #stepoutsideandadventure #fear2fasciantion #msmallory

🔪 🎋Removing Invasive Timber Bamboo 

Although beautiful, timber bamboo can easily choke/shade out other native plants that can be used by wildlife. Unfortunately, their stalks can not be utilized by birds to put nests in or as a food source. Mammals enjoy nesting in the layer of fallen leaves (especially rats), so there is a slight benefit there. However, the cons outweighs the pros when comparing this invasive to native alternatives. 

This is a weekly routine in my backyard. While I can appreciate the shear energy needed to sprout 15 ft in a week’s time, I would prefer they stopped growing and shading out my budding butterfly garden.

#msmalloryadventures #curiousconservationist #stepoutsideandadventure #invasivespeciesremoval ##timberbamboo #plantnative

Wow! Can’t believe the year is already halfway over. 

Thanks to everyone that checked on me the last few months as I slipped away from social media for a bit. 

#Badboymowers has added more responsibilities to my position (so grateful) which has resulted in more time on the road and doing project management stuff—all things that are allowing me to grow in skillsets, as well as value for my team. 🧡 Currently in Arkansas filming for a few projects and loving this thunderstorm ⛈️ 

On the Ms.Mallory side of things, SO MUCH has been done that I need to revisit and share. . . Things I am so proud to have been a part of, but didn’t have the bandwidth to promote properly. I will revisit them all soon, but here is a quick recap:

🌳 Narrated an incredible series produced by @agoetzfilm (with animation by his talented wife @pipandcricket) for @metroparkstoledo 

🎤 Created the @8_minutes_of_eww series that I hope to continue this winter and expand into other series 

🌎 Made a guest appearance on my favorite kids adventure podcast by @earth_rangers 

🦋 Collaborated with some amazing people to create @chattaudubon’s first butterfly nursery that will be expanding soon. 

👕 Launched an online merch store

🐢 Played a small part on an incredible project for #PARC and @usfws  #everyturtlecounts campaign video—hosted by @wildcorwin 

🌸 Finished Phase1 &2 of my Backyard Field Station & Classroom

🎥 Filmed a number of shows/series that will be airing later this year. 

The last 6 months have been a blur, but I couldn’t be happier. Sorry for the ego purge; but halfway through,  I decided to use this ‘check-in’ post as a moment of reflection. It’s easy to think so much time has passed and nothing was accomplished; when in reality, those tiny steps actually carried you further than you thought. 

Looking to return to posting regularly soon! Thanks for all the continued support and love 💕 I would love to hear how you all are doing! Give me a quick update in the comments, if you feel comfortable doing so. 

#msmalloryadvenrures #reflection #checkin #curiousconservationist #stepoutsideandadventure

🍆 🍅 🥬 Produce from your local grocery store chain (whether it is organic or conventional) travels on average 1500 miles from the farm to your plate.

WHY YOU MAY ASK? 

Even though the grocery store appears to have a wide selection of produce, their focus is truly on varieties that will travel well and have a longer shelf life. They aren’t looking for local, but what can be consistent and reliable for their ordering needs (understandably so, ordering logistics are crazy enough for small operations, could you imagine hundreds of stores!).

As a result for the need of  consistency and convenience, produce is shipped from all around the globe even if there are closer options available. 
🥦 🥕 🫑 
Planting a produce garden, dwarf fruit tree, or berry bush (even just a few pots of your favorite food items), along with a few pollinator magnets (the local bees are loving the blue vervain at the moment) can be a great way to reduce your negative environmental impact and increase your beneficial one. . . . Plus you get a yummy reward come harvest time! 

The images you see following the bees are my first day’s harvest from my personal garden. Granted, I have been on the road for most of June so there was plenty to pick, but my garden is roughly 20’ by 20’ and is producing more than I imagined! 

The best part of it all? Being able to share/swap with neighbors, get the community interested in starting their own gardens, and finding more reasons to spend time outside. 

Many think we need to escape to far off places for a fun adventure, but we can create our own— full of discovery, foraging, ingenuity, and imagination— right in our own backyards. 

#msmalloryadventures #curiousconservationist #homesteading #gardening #pollinators #pollinatorgarden #foodie #vegetables #herbs #produce #summer

“⚡️ Storm-Defying Speed! ⚡️ When a pop-up storm hit Dragway 42 in West Salem, Ohio, the race seemed doomed. But thanks to @badboymowers (and the Bad Boy Tractors), we defied the rain and got the track dry in half the usual time! 🌧️💨 Now that’s how you turn setbacks into speedways! 🏁 #BadBoyMowers #BadBoyTractor #RaceDayHeroes #savetherace

🌿🐛 Get ready to go on a caterpillar hunt in your garden! 🌼🔍 Did you know these cute little critters hold some incredible secrets? 

Here are some of my favorite ones! 🐛🔬✨ #CaterpillarAdventure #MetamorphosisMagic

🐛 Fact 1: Caterpillars are eating machines! They have voracious appetites and munch their way through leaves, fueling their growth for the miraculous transformation ahead. 🍃🍽

🦋 Fact 2: Did you know that caterpillars have more muscles than humans? These little wigglers can have up to 4,000 muscles, allowing them to move with incredible agility. They’re like tiny gymnasts in the garden! 💪🌱

🌈 Fact 3: Some caterpillars have amazing camouflage skills. They blend seamlessly into their surroundings, making it harder for predators to spot them. It’s like nature’s own game of hide-and-seek! 🌿🔎

🪱 Fact 4: Caterpillars have a superpower called molting! As they grow, they shed their old skin multiple times, revealing a new, larger skin underneath. It’s their way of leveling up and getting ready for the grand metamorphosis. 🔄🦋

🐛 Fact 5: Caterpillars are the superheroes of transformation! Inside their cozy cocoons or chrysalises, they undergo a remarkable metamorphosis. After a period of rest, they emerge as stunning butterflies or moths, ready to explore the world with their new wings. 🦋✨

So, keep your eyes peeled for these crawling garden gems! Share your caterpillar discoveries with us using the hashtag #CaterpillarAdventure. 📸🐛 Let’s celebrate the wonder of nature’s transformations and inspire others to join the caterpillar craze! 🌼🌿✨

Images of a black swallowtail caterpillar on a dill plant in my garden (photo 1) and a monarch caterpillar on a milkweed plant at @chattaudubon 

#msmalloryadventures #curiousconservationist #stepoutsideandadventure

Yay!! It’s finally here 🎥 🐛 🐘 🦸‍♀️ 

SUPER ANIMALS is airing every weekend on your local fox station. 

🦸‍♂️🐾 Embrace your inner superhero with this show about the INCREDIBLE superpowers in the animal kingdom! 🦸‍♀️

🌍 We’re diving into the world of amazing creatures, from creepy crawlers to mesmerizing marine life. 🦎🐠 

As a guest expert, I got to spill the beans on my favorite critters and their jaw-dropping abilities. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little jealous of nature’s superheroes! Tune in for a family-friendly show that proves fact is way stranger than fiction. 

Airing every weekend on your local fox station! Please send pics and screenshots if you watch and I will highlight you.🌟🎬 #AnimalSuperpowers #NatureHeroes #UnleashTheCuriosity #fear2fascination #curiousconservationist 

Side Note: It’s been quiet on here and wanted to say thank you to everyone that has reached out to keep in touch. You are all amazing!  Social media is an incredible connector, but can be an even greater distractor and time eater. For a season, I decided to exchange online impact with direct impact and have been spending any spare time (not much at the moment) diving into projects that make a ‘boots on the ground’ impact. Don’t worry, this isn’t goodbye – just a little breather. I’ll be back soon with a fresh plan for content, and I can’t wait to catch up properly. Talk to you soon! 🌟🤗 #SteppingBack #SeeYouSoon

Remember, NO TOUCHY TOUCHY when they’re FLUFFY FLUFFY. 🙅🏼‍♀️🤏🐛🧸

Reposted from @treecard As fluffy as it may look, the Southern Flannel Moth caterpillar is one of the most venomous caterpillars in North America 🐛👐#NationalMothWeek

Hidden under its soft coat are venomous spines that can cause intense pain and skin irritation ⚠️ The severity of a reaction is dependent on a person’s sensitivity, but in extreme cases, it can cause nausea, vomiting, tachycardia, difficulty breathing, and fainting 😱

They can be found from New Jersey to Florida and extend as far west as Texas, so if you see one (as with all wildlife) look from a safe distance but please don’t touch!! 😰

Keep nature wild with the Treecard app - we’re giving 80% of our profits to plant trees and clean the ocean - join our community in the link in our bio! 🌳

🎥 @alolasaurusrex - thank you for spreading the knowledge! 💚

🐛🦋 Exciting news, nature lovers! The monarch caterpillar eggs have hatched and are indulging in a feast of milkweed. Did you know that milkweed is their exclusive dining spot? It’s the only plant where these hungry critters can chow down and grow. 🌱🥗

But there’s more to it than meets the eye. Those beautiful gardens we cultivate aren’t just eye candy; they’re lifelines for creatures like the monarch butterflies. 🌼🦋 With their populations declining due to habitat loss, every native garden becomes a vital pit stop during their incredible migrations.

So, let’s keep planting those milkweeds and creating havens for these magnificent flyers. Our gardens aren’t just beautiful, they’re beneficial for wildlife too! 🌸🌿 #MonarchMagic #SaveOurButterflies #GardenForWildlife

🎥 @badboymowers Spokesperson
